### isProfitableIncrement() {#ade9271834ae6b0312cf662fe231a75c4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool IVChain::isProfitableIncrement (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; OperExpr, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; IncExpr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp; SE)</>}>
Return true if the chain increment is profitable to expand into a loop invariant value, which may require its own register.

A profitable chain increment will be an offset relative to the same base. We allow such offsets to potentially be used as chain increment as long as it&#39;s not obviously expensive to expand using real instructions.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l02122">2122</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
